@@ -10,12 +10,19 @@
   "created_at": "2019-01-27T14:55:44Z",
   "github_updated_at": "2019-01-28T00:15:44Z",
   "body_snippet": "***At this time, this issue only applies to the `reapply_credential_manager` branch.***\r\nRelated to #208\r\n\r\nWhen I am importing connections, I should be shown the credentials harvested from the imported file so I can choose where to save them.\r\n\r\nThe solution should have the following qualities:\r\n- When importing connections from any format (.csv, .rdg, etc), a screen should be shown to the user that displays the credentials found during the import.\r\n- If no credential records are found when imp...",
-  "our_status": "new",
-  "priority": null,
+  "our_status": "triaged",
+  "priority": "P3-enhancement",
   "target_release": null,
   "our_branch": null,
   "our_pr": null,
-  "iterations": [],
+  "iterations": [
+    {
+      "seq": 1,
+      "date": "2026-02-17",
+      "type": "triaged",
+      "description": "Feature request to bridge the existing credential manager with the import feature, allowing users to assign credential records during connection import instead of only storing inline credentials."
+    }
+  ],
   "comments": [
     {
       "id": "MDEyOklzc3VlQ29tbWVudDQ1Nzk2MDE2MA==",
@@ -50,5 +57,5 @@
   "needs_action": true,
   "waiting_for_us": true,
   "last_synced": "2026-02-15T09:52:50Z",
-  "notes": ""
+  "notes": "AI triage (claude): Feature request to bridge the existing credential manager with the import feature, allowing users to assign credential records during connection import instead of only storing inline credentials.\nApproach: Add optional credential record reference (CredentialRecordId) to ConnectionInfo, then enhance the import dialog to offer a post-import step where users can map imported connections to existing credential manager entries instead of storing credentials inline."
 }
